APPLICANTS EDUCATED IN FOREIGN COUNTRIES (§ 17-7904) The Board may grant a license to practice speech-language pathology to anpplicant who completed an educational program in a college or university in aoreign country which was not accredited in accordance with § 7902 if thepplicant meets the following requirements: Meets all requirements of this chapter except for § 7902.1; and
(b) Demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Board that the applicant’sducation and training are substantially equivalent to the requirements of thishapter and the Act that the applicant is qualified to practice speech-languageathology by submitting documentation required by § 7904.2 of this section.
An applicant under this section shall, in lieu of meeting the requirements of §902.1, submit one of the following: Proof satisfactory to the Board that the applicant has received a Master’segree or higher from a foreign institution which was accredited, at the timehe degree was conferred, by an accrediting body recognized by the nationalovernment of the country in which the institution is located; or A certification from a private education evaluation service approved by theoard that the applicant’s foreign education is substantially equivalent tohe education provided in an accredited program. The Board may interview an applicant under this section to determine whether thepplicant’s education or training meets the requirements of the Act and thishapter. If a document required by this chapter is in a language other than English, anpplicant shall arrange for its translation into English by a translationervice acceptable to the Board and shall submit a translation signed by theranslator attesting to its accuracy.
